snippet: Fighters with Al Qaeda’s Yemeni affiliate briefly tried to seize control of a military base and the presidential palace before suddenly withdrawing.
abstract: Al Qaeda fighters briefly try to seize military base and presidential palace in Aden, Yemen, before abruptly withdrawing; attempt is viewed as embarrassment for Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi's exiled government, which had claimed it successfully secured port city from Houthi rebels; Al Qaeda's Yemeni branch, which fiercely opposes Houthis, has capitalized on disorder, seizing territory.

byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Mahra, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. An employee of the The New York Times contributed reporting from Aden, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: Fighters with Al Qaeda’s Yemeni affiliate briefly tried to seize control of a military base and the presidential palace before suddenly withdrawing.

headline.main: Al Qaeda Fighters Try to Seize Yemeni Military Base in Aden
headline.print_headline: Al Qaeda Fighters Try to Seize Yemeni Military Base

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
